mediautil.gen
Interface ProgressCallback

public interface ProgressCallback

Interface for notifying progress for use by Callers which need to know of the progress of a time consuming method possibly to display the progress.

Method Summary
 double getCallbackInterval()
          This method is called to get the progress after which the callback should be mande.
 void progressHandler(double fraction, int percent)
          This is the callback method is called when the required progress is made as returned by getCallBackInterval().
 

Method Detail

progressHandler

void progressHandler(double fraction,
                     int percent)
This is the callback method is called when the required progress is made as returned by getCallBackInterval().

Parameters:
fraction - Fraction of the progress made (0-1)
percent - percent of the progress made (0-100)

getCallbackInterval

double getCallbackInterval()
This method is called to get the progress after which the callback should be mande. It should be implemented to return the required Callback Interval which is a fraction between 0-1.

How often this method is called should be specified by the Object providing the callback. It maybe everytime some progress is made or be called just once or be called once in the beginning and once for every callback made.

Returns:
Callback Interval between 0 and 1. For example 0.1 means that progressHandler(..) will be called for every 10% of progress.
